section.title: Introduction
section.t: JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) is a popular format used in web applications. GeoJSON is a format for encoding a variety of geographic data structures using JSON.
Activity JSON has been used in building websites for , , and .

section.title: Normative Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Format
section.t: The locations.json file is in JSON format. It should be array of records.
An empty file should contain just:
Here's an example of a file with just one entry:

figure.artwork: [ {"n": "Kattilajärven iso lippaluola, Nuuksio, Espoo", "lat": 60.30145486, "lon": 24.62792567, "m": "https://example.com/cavemap-kattilajarvi.pdf", "l": 9.3, "la": "exact", "k": "Espoo", "c": "Finland", "o": "Europe", "rl": [{ "t": "Kattilajärvi roof caves", "i": "https://example.com/kattilajarvi-pic.jpg" "w": ["Jari"], "y": 2020, "m": 5, "a": ["Caving"], "sa": ["Rock"], "u": "https://example.com/kattilajarvi-article.html" } ] } ]

section.t:
Where the fields are as follows:
The name of the place. By convention the last item of the name (after last comma) should be city name. Mandatory.
The coordinates, in WGS84 format. Mandatory.
An optional attribute that describes the altitude the location or the highest point in the destination, in memeters.
Set to true if the coordinates are "fuzzy" to hide the true location for privacy etc. reasons. Default is false. This attribute is optional.
The cave map link URL, if any. If there's no URL, the attribute should not be specified at all (and should not be set to, e.g., empty string, although it is recommended that software recognises empty strings similarly to missing attributes.
The length of the cave in meters, if known. The attribute is optional, and should be left out if no value is known.
The cave length accuracy ("exact" or "approx"). The attribute is optional, and the default value is "approx" if no other value is provided.
The city/town/county. This attribute is mandatory.
The country. This attribute is mandatory.
The continent. This attribute is mandatory.
The "reading list", a list of articles describing visits etc. This can of course be empty, i.e., [], but the attribute itself is mandatory.

Where each article has the following fields:
The title. This attribute is mandatory.
URL for an image representing the article. This attribute is optional. If no image URL known, the attribute should not be specified at all.
List of people who were there. This attribute is mandatory.
Year of visit (as a number). This attribute is mandatory.
The month of visit (as a number, between 1-12). This attribute is mandatory.
The activity: Caving, Skiing, etc. This attribute is mandatory.
The sub-activity, e.g., within caving the allowed sub-activities or cave types are Rock, Ice, Man-made, Science, and Equipment and within skiing they are Outdoor, Indoor, Snow, Sand, Rock, Ash, Asphalt, Grass, Mud, Plastic, Other-substances, and Imported-snow. This attribute is mandatory.
URL for the article. This attribute is optional. If no URL is known, the attribute should not be specified at all.
